Experiment Method.Assay Method: Western Blotting for α-synuclein Binding Assay

Material used.Description: Synaptosomes were prepared from cerebral cortices of α-syn KO mice and used as the acceptor fraction for α-syn binding assays.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P α-syn showed significantly lower binding to synaptic membranes compared to Wt and A53T, though binding was improved by co-incubation with cytosol.
A53T α-syn binding to synaptic membranes was comparable to Wt, with significant enhancement by cytosol at high concentrations.
E46K mutation was mentioned but not specifically tested in the binding assays described in the literature.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed with multiple samples as indicated by n=4 in statistical analysis.

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-syn was used as a positive control for binding comparison.

Basic negative control.Description: No specific negative control mentioned for the binding assay.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-Way ANOVA with Bonferroni's multiple comparison test and Student's T-test were used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Binding levels comparable to Wt α-syn (approximately 60% of soluble α-syn interacting with membrane).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Binding levels significantly lower than Wt α-syn, as observed with A30P (small amount stably binding to membrane).

Material used.Description: Cytosol from α-syn KO mouse brains was used to identify lipid cofactors interacting with α-syn.

Readout description.Result Description: Specific effects of lipids on A30P α-syn binding were not individually quantified in LC-ESI-MS analysis.
Specific effects of lipids on A53T α-syn binding were not individually quantified in LC-ESI-MS analysis.
E46K mutation was not tested in the lipid analysis assays described in the literature.

Biological replicates.Description: No specific mention of biological replicates for LC-ESI-MS in the literature.

Technical replicates.Description: Replicate experiments were performed for validation with deuterated standards.

Basic positive control.Description: Deuterated standards (d4-16:0 PAF) were used for validation of lipid identification.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-specific lipid binding was assessed by analysis of immunoprecipitates from KO cytosol.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Data expressed as fold change in lipid abundance above background.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Lipid abundance comparable to Wt cytosol levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in lipid abundance from Wt cytosol levels (e.g., >2-fold change).
